pr_title: KAFKA-9313: Set `use_all_dns_ips` as the new default for `client.dns.lookup` (KIP-602)

timeline.message: Make use.all.dns.ips as the default behaviour fir client.dns.lookup configuration
Added use_first_dns_ips option for client.dns.lookup configuration

timeline.bodyText: In the KIP this field is called use_first_dns_ip, I think it was agreed in the discussion to remove the s
timeline.author: mimaison

replies.bodyText: I edited the PR to include this change.
replies.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: @mimaison Based on @ijuma 's suggestion, I am not adding use_first_dns_ip. I am going to deprecate default as the value and make use_all_dns_ips as the default value.
replies.author: badaiaqrandista

replies.bodyText: I agree it makes sense to not introduce this new value. It's unfortunate the old value is called default but hopefully we'll remove it in the next major release.
replies.author: mimaison

replies.bodyText: ok. resolving this conversation.
replies.author: badaiaqrandista

timeline.message: use_first_dns_ips -> use_first_dns_ip
use_first_dns_ips -> use_first_dns_ip

timeline.bodyText: @badaiaqrandista We should replace this if/else with a switch statement so that we are forced to handle every case. That makes it easier to avoid issues if we add new elements to the enum. Also, can we please add tests?
timeline.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: Btw, it seems that we are changing the behavior of RESOLVE_CANONICAL_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS_ONLY as well, right? Before, we would only use the first DNS IP for that option in the non bootstrap path. It would be good to make that clear in the KIP.
replies.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: Yes, you are correct. If client.dns.lookup=RESOLVE_CANONICAL_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS_ONLY , then it will resolves the hostname to IP address using the default behaviour.
replies.author: badaiaqrandista

replies.bodyText: I've changed this into switch/case and updated the KIP.
replies.author: badaiaqrandista

replies.bodyText: Can we remove the default since we handled all the cases?
replies.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: ok. will remove the default.
replies.author: badaiaqrandista

timeline.bodyText: We said this would be deprecated for removal in 3.0. Let's mention that in the documentation and add a warning if this is selected.
timeline.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: Thinking about it, maybe we should not add this at all. We could deprecate default and switch the config default to use_all_dns_ips. Thoughts @badaiaqrandista and @rajinisivaram?
replies.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText:
I think that is a better idea, instead of introducing new value that would be removed soon.
ClientDnsLookup.DEFAULT is used in few places in core (server):
https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/trunk/core/src/main/scala/kafka/server/KafkaServer.scala#L520
https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/trunk/core/src/main/scala/kafka/server/ReplicaFetcherBlockingSend.scala#L92
https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/trunk/core/src/main/scala/kafka/controller/ControllerChannelManager.scala#L156
https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/trunk/core/src/main/scala/kafka/coordinator/transaction/TransactionMarkerChannelManager.scala#L82
And a couple of tools:
https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/trunk/core/src/main/scala/kafka/tools/ReplicaVerificationTool.scala#L482
https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/trunk/core/src/main/scala/kafka/admin/BrokerApiVersionsCommand.scala#L299
It is also used literally in a lot of test cases under clients.
I did not want to touch too many code in the first go. Should I change them all in this KIP or leave them until we remove ClientDnsLookup.DEFAULT in 3.0 ?
replies.author: badaiaqrandista

replies.bodyText: @badaiaqrandista I think you should change it in the non test code in this PR. For the test code, we can do it in a separate PR.
replies.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: Ok. I have changed core code to use ClientDnsLookup.USE_ALL_DNS_IPS and leaving all clients tests except ClientUtilsTest.
replies.author: badaiaqrandista

timeline.bodyText: This will warn on every resolve. We should probably add the warning when we get the config value from ConsumerConfig, ProducerConfig and AdminClientConfig.

timeline.bodyText: Can we clarify that resolve_canonical_bootstrap_servers_only applies to the boostrap urls only. For advertised servers, both use_all_dns_ips and resolve_canonical_bootstrap_servers behave the same.
timeline.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: Sorry, I do not understand why you are referring to "advertised servers". Instead, I have changed the explanation to clarify that this only applies "if bootstrap hostname is an alias to multiple canonical names".
replies.author: badaiaqrandista

replies.bodyText: Each of these configs have an impact on bootstrap and advertized servers. So, we should be clear on what they do for each case.
replies.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: Config doc updated.
replies.author: badaiaqrandista

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need this change?
timeline.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText:
because kafka.apache.org resolves to 2 IP addresses. and I want to be sure that DEFAULT only returns 1 of them.
localhost resolves to 1 IP address.
replies.author: badaiaqrandista

replies.bodyText: Can you add a comment about this?
replies.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: Added.
replies.author: badaiaqrandista

timeline.bodyText: Can we add a test that passes RESOLVE_CANONICAL_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS_ONLY showing that we now get multiple addresses instead of only the first one. That's one of the changes in this PR.
timeline.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: Added.
replies.author: badaiaqrandista
